intro: Strychnos zizyphoides, commonly known as the Indian strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy aril. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is important to handle the plant with care.
